entry.title: Seven minutes in heaven
entry.summary:
Author: NightWrites_leaf

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 150,663Chapters: 23/?Kudos: 333

Summary: Dick Grayson decided that the Young Justice crew and the Titans needed a proper official meting, no missions, no explosions, just hanging out as a big group of friends… with some alcohol. They end up playing never have I ever and seven minutes in haven. Wally and Dick end up just a little too close in the closet and they now have to figure out what this thing between them is. The fic is filled with character dynamics, fluff, smut, crack, angst and heartbreak! - and it is currently ongoing BUT i post pretty regularly (at least one chapter a week).

entry.title: Fruits of Our Labor
entry.summary:
Author: acatcam

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 17,202Chapters: 13/?Kudos: 168

Summary: Clark Kent and Bruce Wayne have been dating for a year—quietly, carefully, and very much in love. In public, they’re professional colleagues; in private, Bruce teases and Clark blushes his way through domestic bliss. Meeting the four Wayne sons was nerve-wracking enough, but now Bruce has been acting… off.A “stomach bug,” Clark insists.A “mystery,” Bruce argues.Neither of them expect the doctor’s results that leave Bruce speechless—and Clark ugly crying with joy. Or: a fic about fatherhood, family dinners, a overprotective farmboy, and the world’s most unexpected pregnancy

entry.title: “Is There Any More Surprises?”
entry.summary:
Author: acatcam

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 17,463Chapters: 13/?Kudos: 222

Summary: Damian Wayne thought he knew what he was walking into when his mother dropped him off with Bruce Wayne. A spoiled playboy with too many tabloids under his belt — easy enough to ignore. Instead, he gets a Batcave, two older brothers who don’t stop bickering, and a father who is very much not what he expected.Adjusting to “normal” school life is already a downgrade from his old world, but things only get stranger when he meets a clumsy, soft-hearted boy named Jon Kent… who turns out to be anything but ordinary. Discovering his father is in league with Superman is one thing; realizing Superman’s son keeps crossing his path is another.At sixteen, Damian is just trying to survive his new reality — brothers, secrets, vigilantes, and maybe even a super-powered friendship that could mean more.

entry.title: Whatever happened to imaginary friends?
entry.summary:
Author: CoffeeTrees

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 80,386Chapters: 17/20Kudos: 1,338

Summary: Tim, the ever vigilant (always awake and never giving himself a break) vigilante, gets word of a drug bust going down. One he just so happens to be the only one available to stop. Which happens to be taking place in the very early hours of his birthday. Of course he goes on the highly dangerous bust alone. What could happen? Or: Tim is used to being the Robin that gets thing handled, that doesn't need Batman to come rescue him. Bruce Wayne had made it very clear in the early days that Tim was not his son. Alfred Pennyworth was cold, allowing only the politeness and distance to show through his Iron Wall. Dick Grayson treated him the way he wished he'd treated his brother, Jason.Tim was fine with this. He wasn't a child. Even if he wished for more of the small slivers of love the Wayne family were just starting to give him, he wouldn't dare take Jason Todd's place. He just hoped the support he provided for the grieving family would make Jason proud. But Jason Todd came back, and he sure made it known he wasn't. He made sure Tim knew exactly what he thought of the cuckoo in his family.Now, the Wayne family has their lost son back and Tim has a job to do. Just, not in this dimension?

entry.title: There's Something So Lonesome About You
entry.summary:
Author: hoeforhoran28

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 71,691Chapters: 17/?Kudos: 1,213

Summary: "Your identity was supposed to be a secret. Not only to protect yourself (and probably least importantly yourself) but others. Your family, your friends. Everyone who stood a chance at being ripped apart by your decision to go out there everyday and put yourself in the crossfire.Not that Bruce had anyone to protect, besides Alfred. But it was still a fucking given."Or: Bruce has been Batman for two years and if he knew anything, it was that when you don a mask, you don it for a reason. An important reason that just doesn't seem to be as important to the rest of the League as it is to him. This is going to be a story about Bruce being coaxed into allowing others behind his carefully built walls. (Specifically one person.)

entry.title: Threshold
entry.summary:
Author: jhnycged

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,013Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 3

Summary: The flood has passed, but Gotham hasn’t healed — neither has Batman. Bruce thought he understood what darkness was, what justice meant, and where the line between the two lived. But then a piece of encrypted footage surfaces, something alien… something impossible. It’s not just about Metropolis anymore - it’s about the world. And the voice on that footage whispers a message that shakes him to his core: Superman wasn’t sent here to protect the people of earth. In the foreign city of Metropolis, Batman becomes a shadow again. But the closer he gets to the truth behind Superman, the more the lines begin to blur — between mission and obsession, between trust and weakness, between the man he is and the mask he can’t take off.

entry.title: Undercover in Metropolis
entry.summary:
Author: brmqtr

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,048Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 27

Summary: When a weapons investigation leads straight into Metropolis, Bruce Wayne finds himself in the worst possible disguise — Clark Kent’s cousin. Under the alias “Brandon Kent,” he’s forced to survive office small talk, coffee breaks, and Lois Lane’s laser-sharp curiosity while secretly dismantling a tech-smuggling ring. Clark handles charm, Bruce handles chaos, and together they create the most suspiciously competent duo the Daily Planet has ever seen. Between awkward lunches, coded glances, and one too many close calls, their cover starts to slip — and so does Bruce’s resolve to keep his feelings off-record. After all, pretending not to love Superman has never been his strongest skill.

Summary: The first clone of Superman was rescued by members of Young Justice: Robin, Kid Flash, and Aqualad. He was given a name, a place, a semblance of family. Conner Kent.A man Clark now views as his brother.But, what if the second clone Lex created wasn’t just another version of Superman? What if the missing DNA sequence was taken from Kara? What if the clone was programmed for mind games, rather than physical confrontation?—In which Clark Kent discovers the newest piece of life-altering news: He has another clone. But this time? The clone sees herself as his daughter.Alternative POVS: Part One- Clark, Dick, and Conner
